TopicTitle: Optional wear and tear on parts(lifespace of parts)

Articles.Content:
Similar to life support. What about lifespan limits to parts. This could give another way to limit and make stuff more realistic. This could be an option during creation of a game. And it could have cheats to get around it if needed.

You could also have degradation and efficiency of parts.

this could all give a lot ore reason to use and even have more parts. Different materials could extend life while adding weight or other qualities. If it's based on real things it could be nice.

Edited January 20, 2021 by Arugela

maybe if it was wear due to ex high heat instead of a time because it would pe a big pain having to constantly repair space stations. i do think it would be cool if there was some vissual damage to things when they it the ground hard or get really hot. maybe tiss would work like so that there is no time damage if you have an engeneer on the ship? tbh it would be cool comming back to an unmanned station and it looks a bit worse than it used to.
the kerbalism mod already does that, among other things.

I wasn't going for time. More use and conditions. Whatever is most realistic. That just happens to happen over time.

Anyway, it would be fairly interesting to have a hidden wear value for a part that dictates its appearance and detriments, the rate of increase multiplied by some setting (0-1-10) set on start. That’s how I imagine part deterioration.
